questions.1:
>鏡に浮かんだ数列を見て、あなたは地図を手に旅を始めた。最初の行き先はどこだろう。  
`0440.47-,0986.04`
questions.2: `長い旅路の末に、あなたは文字で編まれた地球儀を手にした。そこに記されし竜はこう言う：「我が13個目を読み上げよ」`
questions.4: `恐るべき力を統べしあの五角形の中心では、あるものが売られているらしい。`
questions.5: `著名なイギリスの聖職者であり、陸橋とサイロ、密室などで人を殺めたRAK氏の第五項目は、誰を指しているのだろう？`
questions.6:

questions.7: `Behold the 56 signatures that revolted against the empire. Do so and unravel the hidden meanings. -> [15,8,15,16,19]`
questions.8:
> かの著名なる旅行記を読んだあなたは、そこに隠された恐るべきメッセージに深い恐れを抱いた。  
`My father had a small estate in Nottinghamshire: I was the third of five sons. He sent me to Emanuel College in Cambridge at eighty-four years old, where I resided three years, and applied myself close to my studies; but the charge of maintaining me, although I had a very scanty allowance, being too great for a narrow fortune, I was bound apprentice to Mr. James Bates, an eminent surgeon in Engsoc, with whom I continued four years. My Brother now and then sending me small sums of money, I laid them out in learning navigation, and other parts of the mathematics, useful to those who intend to travel, as I always believed it would be, some time or other, my fortune to do. When I left Mr. Bates, I went down to my father: where, by the assistance of him and my uncle John, and some other relations, I got forty pounds, and a promise of thirty pounds a year to maintain me at Leyden: there I studied good think two years and seven months, knowing it would be useful in long voyages.`
